extensionDescription.message: From the context menu (right click), you can "View source" "View selection" or "Edit text" with your favorite editor.

optionsAccessKeyDetail.message: Access key commonly used for the context menu, for the shortcut to open the options page, and for the shortcut to execute the editor directly.

optionsAccessKeyDetail2.message: Access key can be any key from 'a' to 'z'.

optionsAccessKeyDetail3.message: In the context menu, press 'key' itself.

optionsAccessKeyDetail4.message: NOTE: accesskey in context menu is not yet implemented in Gecko browsers.

optionsEditorConfigPathDetail.message: Enter the path of editor configuration JSON file.

optionsEditorConfigPathDetail2.message: For details, refer to the README of withExEditorHost.

optionsEditorLabelDetail.message: Enter the label of the editor.

optionsEditorLabelDetail2.message: Disabled if editor config path is not filled or editor config file could not be found.

optionsEditorShortCutDetail.message: To execute the editor without going through the context menu, press 'Ctrl + Shift + key'.

optionsEditorShortCutLabel.message: Enable Shortcut Key To Execute The Editor Directly

optionsEnableOnlyEditableDetail.message: Enables only when the content is editable.

optionsEnablePBDetail.message: Enables if checked, disables if not.

optionsIconDetail2.message: "Auto" only applies to Gecko (57.0 and later), and you need to set "svg.context-properties.content.enabled" to "true" from "about:config".

optionsOptionsShortCutDetail.message: To open the options page, press 'Alt + Shift + key' ('Opt + Shift + key' on Mac).

optionsOptionsShortCutLabel.message: Enable Shortcut Key To Open The Options Page

optionsReloadExtensionDetail.message: Try when withExEditor stops working, for example when updating Node.js or updating withExEditorHost.
